sen.j: 笠置駅（かさぎえき）は、京都府相楽郡笠置町にある、西日本旅客鉄道（JR西日本）関西本線の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Located in Kasagi-cho, Soraku-gun, Kyoto Prefecture, Kasagi Station is a stop on the Kansai Main Line, which is operated by the West Japan Railway Company (JR West).
Located in Kasagi-cho, Soraku-gun, Kyoto Prefecture, Kasagi Station is a stop on the Kansai Main Line, which is operated by the West Japan Railway Company (JR West).
Located in Kasagi-cho, Soraku-gun, Kyoto Prefecture, Kasagi Station is a stop on the Kansai Main Line, which is operated by the West Japan Railway Company (JR West).

sen.j: 当駅以東はICOCA・Jスルーの利用可能エリアから外れるため、これらのカード（ICOCAの相互利用対象であるSuica（東日本旅客鉄道）・PiTaPa（スルッとKANSAI協議会）も含む）は利用できない。
sen.e: Because the eastern area of this station is excluded from the area in which ICOCA and J-Through Card are available, not only these cards but Suica (East Japan Railway Company), which is mutual exploitation of ICOCA, and PiTaPa (SURUTTO KANSAI ASSOCIATION) are not available as well.

The ICOCA and J-Through cards and, due to a reciprocal agreement, East Japan Railway Company's Suica card and SURUTTO KANSAI ASSOCIATION's PiTaPa card are not valid in the area to the east of the station.
sen.cmt: Reworded sentence"eastern area of this"→"area to the east of the""mutual exploitation"→"reciprocal agreement"
sen.e: The ICOCA and J-Through cards and, due to a reciprocal agreement, East Japan Railway Company's Suica card and SURUTTO KANSAI ASSOCIATION's PiTaPa card are not valid in the area to the east of the station.

sen.j: 関西本線は当駅から関駅 (三重県)までの各駅が西日本旅客鉄道大阪支社亀山鉄道部の管轄となっている。
sen.e: Each station located in the section of the Kansai Main Line between this station and Seki Station (Mie Prefecture) is under the control of the Kameyama Railways Department, Osaka Branch Office, West Japan Railway Company.

Each station on the Kansai Main Line section between this station and Seki Station (Mie Prefecture) is under the control of the Kameyama Railways Department, Osaka Branch Office, West Japan Railway Company.

Each station on the Kansai Main Line section between this station and Seki Station (Mie Prefecture) is under the control of the Kameyama Railways Department, Osaka Branch Office, West Japan Railway Company.

sen.j: 隣の加茂駅からは大阪支社直轄駅となる。
sen.e: Stations located on the other side of the Kansai Main Line from Kamo Station are under the direct control of the Osaka Branch Office.
Stations from neighboring Kamo Station onwards are under the direct control of the Osaka Branch Office.
sen.cmt: "located on the other side of the Kansai Main Line from Kamo Station"→"from the neighboring Kamo Station onwards"
sen.e: Stations from neighboring Kamo Station onwards are under the direct control of the Osaka Branch Office.

sen.j: 1面2線のプラットホームを持つ地上駅である。
sen.e: It is an aboveground station that has a single platform, both sides of which are used for boarding and exiting trains in two opposing directions respectively.
Kasagi Station is an aboveground station with a single island platform serving two tracks.
sen.cmt: Deleted "both sides of which are used for boarding and exiting trains in two opposing directions respectively" - not in original and not necessary
sen.e: Kasagi Station is an aboveground station with a single island platform serving two tracks.

sen.j: 駅舎側にもう1本貨物用の路線が敷設されていた。
sen.e: There used to be another railway for freight trains on the side of the station building.
There used to be another railway for freight trains to the side of the station building.
There used to be another railway for freight trains to the side of the station building.

sen.j: かつては奈良方面へ笠置始発着の列車も設定されていた。
sen.e: Some trains used to be operated for Nara from Kasagi Station as a starting station.
Some trains used to leave Kasagi Station for Nara.
Some trains used to leave Kasagi Station for Nara.

sen.j: また行楽期には準急（のち急行）「かすが」の臨時停車も行われていた。
sen.e: In tourist seasons, (Semi-) Express "Kasuga" used to stop at this station on a temporary basis.
During tourist seasons, the (Semi-) Express "Kasuga" used to stop at this station on a temporary basis.
During tourist seasons, the (Semi-) Express 'Kasuga' used to stop at this station on a temporary basis.

sen.j: 日本国有鉄道時代には東京からの急行「大和」も通過しており、またホーム長も8連編成に対応して旧本線時代の栄華が偲ばれる。
sen.e: In the Japan National Railways era, Express "Yamato" from Tokyo used to pass this station, and the length of the platform is designed for 8-car trains, which reminds us of the glory days in the old main line era.

In the Japan National Railways era, the Express "Yamato" from Tokyo used to pass this station, and the length of the platform, which was designed for 8-car trains, is a reminder of the glory days of the old main line era.
sen.cmt: Added "the""is"→"which was""which remind us"→"is a reminder""in"→"of"
sen.e: In the Japan National Railways era, the Express 'Yamato' from Tokyo used to pass this station, and the length of the platform, which was designed for 8-car trains, is a reminder of the glory days of the old main line era.

sen.j: ホームの基礎は関西鉄道時代の石組み造りである。
sen.e: The foundation of the platform is constructed in a stone-arrangement structure which was a mainstream structure when Kansei Railway Company owned this station.
The platform foundation is a stone structure built when Kansei Railway Company owned the station.
sen.cmt: Moved "platform"Deleted "constructed in"and "-arrangement""which was a mainstream structure"→"built"
sen.e: The platform foundation is a stone structure built when Kansei Railway Company owned the station.

sen.j: また跨線橋・駅本屋・待合室等も関西鉄道時代の体面を保ち、鉄道情景に出てきそうな要素を含んだ貴重な駅である。
sen.e: Its overpass, main station building and waiting room still retain some remnants of appearances in the Kansei Railway era, and these classic appearances, which are in harmony with the scene of railways, make Kasagi Station precious.
The bridge, main station building and waiting room still retain their appearance from the Kansei Railway era, making Kasagi a picturesque and valuable station.
sen.cmt: "Its overpass"→"The bridge"-"overpass" is OK but it makes me think of roads rather than pedestriansReworded last part of sentence.
sen.e: The bridge, main station building and waiting room still retain their appearance from the Kansei Railway era, making Kasagi a picturesque and valuable station.

sen.j: なお駅舎とホームは跨線橋で連絡している。
sen.e: The station building and the platform are connected with the overpass.
The station building and the platform are connected by a bridge.
The station building and the platform are connected by a bridge.

sen.j: また、早朝・夜間は無人となる。
sen.e: No station attendant remains at the station early in the morning and at night.
The station is unattended early in the morning and at night.
sen.cmt: "No station attendant remains at the station"→"The station is unattended"
sen.e: The station is unattended early in the morning and at night.

sen.j: コインロッカーが設置されている。
sen.e: Some lockers and coin lockers are set up.
There are some lockers and coin-operated lockers.
sen.cmt: Added "there are"Deleted "are set up"- I think the first "ロッカー" might be a typo.
sen.e: There are some coin-operated lockers.
sen.cmt: lockers and削除サイトを確認し、原文からロッカーを削除

sen.j: 笠置温泉
sen.e: Kasagi Onsen (hot spring)
Kasagi Onsen (hot spring)
Kasagi Onsen (hot spring)

sen.j: 笠置郵便局
sen.e: Kasagi post office
Kasagi Post Office
Kasagi Post Office

sen.j: 京都府立笠置山自然公園法
sen.e: Kyoto Prefecture Kasagiyama Natural Parks (Kasagiyama Shizen Koen) Act
Kyoto Prefecture Kasagiyama Nature Park (Kasagiyama Shizen Koen)
sen.cmt: I think the "法"must be a typo. It doesn't make any sense in the context and I could find no references to it.
sen.e: Kyoto Prefecture Kasagiyama Nature Park (Kasagiyama Shizen Koen)

sen.j: 駅南東に椿本神社・後醍醐天皇行在所跡のある笠置山 (京都府)がある。
sen.e: There is Mt. Kasagi-yama (Kyoto Prefecture), on which the Tsubakimoto-jinja Shrine and Emperor Go-Daigo Anzaisho site are located, in the southeast of the station.
To the southeast of the station lies Mt. Kasagi-yama (Kyoto Prefecture), where Tsubakimoto-jinja Shrine and the site of Emperor Go-Daigo Anzaisho's lodge are located.
sen.cmt: Moved "the southeast of the station""in"→"To""There is"→"lies""on which"→"where"Deleted "the"Added "site of...lodge"
sen.e: To the southeast of the station lies Mt. Kasagi-yama (Kyoto Prefecture), where Tsubakimoto-jinja Shrine and the site of Emperor Godaigo Anzaisho's lodge are located.

sen.j: 木津川 (京都府)を挟んで並行に、南岸に関西本線、北岸に国道163号がある。
sen.e: Across Kizu-gawa River (Kyoto Prefecture), the Kansai Main Line along its south bank and National Highway 163 along its north bank run in parallel.
The Kansai Main Line runs along the south bank of Kizu-gawa River (Kyoto Prefecture) and National Highway 163 runs along its north bank.
The Kansai Main Line runs along the south bank of Kizu-gawa River (Kyoto Prefecture) and National Highway 163 runs along its north bank.

sen.j: 北岸に笠置町役場と笠置小学校があり、笠置大橋（京都府道・奈良県道4号笠置山添線）が南北を結んでいる。
sen.e: The Kasagi town office and Kasagi Elementary School are located on the north bank of the river, and the Kasagi-Ohashi Bridge (Kyoto and Nara prefectural road No.4, Kasagi Yamazoe Route) connects the north area and the south area.

Kasagi Town Hall and Kasagi Elementary School are located on the north bank of the river, and the Kasagi-Ohashi Bridge (Kyoto and Nara prefectural road No.4, Kasagi Yamazoe Route) connects the north and south sides.

Kasagi Town Hall and Kasagi Elementary School are located on the north bank of the river, and the Kasagi-Ohashi Bridge (Kyoto and Nara prefectural road No.4, Kasagi Yamazoe Route) connects the north and south sides.

sen.j: 1897年（明治30年）11月11日 - 伊賀上野駅～加茂駅 (京都府)間の開通時に、関西鉄道の駅（鉄道駅一般駅）として開業。
sen.e: November 11, 1897: Started as a station (general rail station) of Kansei Railway Company when the operation between Iga-Ueno Station and Kamo Station (Kyoto Prefecture) was started.
November 11, 1897: Opened as a Kansei Railway Company station (general rail station) of Kansei Railway Company when service between Iga-Ueno Station and Kamo Station (Kyoto Prefecture) commenced.
sen.cmt: Rewrote in more 'note' style, as in original, deleting auxilliaries, articles, etc.
sen.e: November 11, 1897: Opened as a station (general rail station) of Kansei Railway Company when service between Iga-Ueno Station and Kamo Station (Kyoto Prefecture) commenced.

sen.j: 1907年（明治40年）10月1日 - 関西鉄道が鉄道国有法。
sen.e: October 1, 1907: Kansei Railway Company was nationalized in compliance with the Railway Nationalization Act.
sen.cmt: 「関西鉄道が（鉄道国有法により）国有化された。」という解釈で訳出いたしました。
sen.e: October 1, 1907: Kansei Railway Company nationalized in compliance with Railway Nationalization Act.
sen.cmt: Rewrote in more 'note' style, as in original, deleting auxilliaries, articles, etc.
sen.e: October 1, 1907: Kansei Railway Company nationalized in compliance with Railway Nationalization Act.

sen.j: 1909年（明治42年）10月12日 - 鉄道路線の名称制定により、関西本線所属となる。
sen.e: October 12, 1909: The line to which the station belonged changed to the Kansai Main Line.
October 12, 1909: Name of line changed to Kansai Main Line.
sen.cmt: Rewrote in more 'note' style, as in original, deleting auxilliaries, articles, etc."The line to whichh the station belonged"→"Name of line"
sen.e: October 12, 1909: Name of line changed to Kansai Main Line.

sen.j: 1962年（昭和37年）10月1日 - 貨物営業廃止（鉄道駅旅客駅となる）。
sen.e: October 1, 1962: The freight car services were discontinued (Services only for passengers started).
October 1, 1962: Freight services discontinued (changed to passenger-only station).
sen.cmt: Rewrote in more 'note' style, as in original, deleting auxilliaries, articles, etc.1"Services only for passengers started"→"Changed to passenger-only station"
sen.e: October 1, 1962: Freight services discontinued (changed to passenger-only station).

sen.j: 1987年（昭和62年）4月1日 - 国鉄分割民営化により、JR西日本の駅となる。
sen.e: April 1, 1987: Based on the division and privatization of JNR, the station owned by West Japan Railway Company.
April 1, 1987: Following division and privatization of JNR, ownership passed to West Japan Railway Company.
sen.cmt: Rewrote in more 'note' style, as in original, deleting auxilliaries, articles, etc."Based on the"→"Following""the station owned by"→"ownership passed to"
sen.e: April 1, 1987: Following division and privatization of JNR, ownership passed to West Japan Railway Company.

sen.j: 西日本旅客鉄道（JR西日本）
sen.e: West Japan Railway Company (JR West)
West Japan Railway Company (JR West)
West Japan Railway Company (JR West)

sen.j: 関西本線
sen.e: Kansai Main Line
Kansai Main Line
Kansai Main Line

sen.j: 大河原駅 (京都府) - 笠置駅 - 加茂駅 (京都府)
sen.e: Okawara Station (Kyoto Prefecture) - Kasagi Station - Kamo Station (Kyoto Prefecture)
Okawara Station (Kyoto Prefecture) - Kasagi Station - Kamo Station (Kyoto Prefecture)
Okawara Station (Kyoto Prefecture) - Kasagi Station - Kamo Station (Kyoto Prefecture)
